definitions.definition: A group, collection, category or set sharing characteristics or attributes.
definitions.example: Often used to imply membership of a large class.

definitions.definition: A social grouping, based on job, wealth, etc. In Britain, society is commonly split into three main classes; upper class, middle class and working class.
The division of society into classes.
definitions.example: Jane Austen's works deal with class in 18th-century England.

definitions.definition: Admirable behavior; elegance.
definitions.example: Apologizing for losing your temper, even though you were badly provoked, showed real class.

definitions.definition: A group of students in a regularly scheduled meeting with a teacher.
definitions.example: The class was noisy, but the teacher was able to get their attention with a story.

definitions.definition: A series of lessons covering a single subject.
definitions.example: I took the cooking class for enjoyment, but I also learned a lot.

definitions.definition: A group of students who commenced or completed their education during a particular year. A school class.
definitions.example: The class of 1982 was particularly noteworthy.

definitions.definition: A category of seats in an airplane, train or other means of mass transportation.
definitions.example: I used to fly business class, but now my company can only afford economy.

definitions.definition: A rank in the classification of organisms, below phylum and above order; a taxon of that rank.
definitions.example: Magnolias belong to the class Magnoliopsida.

definitions.definition: Best of its kind.
definitions.example: It is the class of Italian bottled waters.

definitions.definition: A grouping of data values in an interval, often used for computation of a frequency distribution.
A collection of sets definable by a shared property.
definitions.example: Every set is a class, but classes are not generally sets. A class that is not a set is called a proper class.

definitions.definition: A group of people subject to be conscripted in the same military draft, or more narrowly those persons actually conscripted in a particular draft.
A set of objects having the same behavior (but typically differing in state), or a template defining such a set.
One of the sections into which a Methodist church or congregation is divided, supervised by a class leader.
To assign to a class; to classify.
definitions.example: I would class this with most of the other mediocre works of the period.

definitions.definition: To be grouped or classed.
To divide into classes, as students; to form into, or place in, a class or classes.
A class or order; sort; kind.

An ecclesiastical body or judicatory in certain churches, such as the Reformed Dutch. It is intermediate between the consistory and the synod, and corresponds to the presbytery in the Presbyterian church.
